item.title: Fredstrong add a quote by Tom Robbins
item.description: "Disbelief in magic can force a poor soul into believing in government and business." -- Tom Robbins

item.title: Fredstrong add a quote by Kurt Vonnegut
item.description: "We are what we pretend to be, so we must be careful about what we pretend to be." -- Kurt Vonnegut

item.title: Fredstrong add a quote by Chuck Palahniuk
item.description: "Your birth is a mistake you'll spend your whole life trying to correct." -- Chuck Palahniuk

item.title: Fredstrong add a quote by Alan Moore
item.description: "My experience of life is that it is not divided up into genres; it’s a horrifying, romantic, tragic, comical, science-fiction cowboy detective novel. You know, with a bit of pornography if you're lucky." -- Alan Moore

item.title: Fredstrong add a quote by Aleister Crowley
item.description: "Ordinary morality is only for ordinary people." -- Aleister Crowley

item.title: Fredstrong add a quote by Anne Rice
item.description: "Roman influence seeds itself, sprouting mighty oaks right through the modern forest of computers, digital disks, microviruses and space satellites." -- Anne Rice

item.title: Fredstrong add a quote by Paul Auster
item.description: "We construct a narrative for ourselves, and that's the thread that we follow from one day to the next. People who disintegrate as personalities are the ones who lose that thread." -- Paul Auster

item.title: Fredstrong add a quote by Mark Z. Danielewski
item.description: "Why did god create a dual universe? So he might say ‘Be not like me. I am alone.' And it might be heard." -- Mark Z. Danielewski

item.title: Fredstrong add a quote by Ram Dass
item.description: "If you think you're free, there's no escape possible." -- Ram Dass

item.title: Fredstrong add a quote by Grant Morrison
item.description: "Metaphor is one of a group of problem-solving medicines known as figures of speech which are normally used to treat literal thinking and other diseases." -- Grant Morrison

item.title: Fredstrong add a quote by Hunter S. Thompson
item.description: "You took too much man, too much, too much." -- Hunter S. Thompson

item.title: Fredstrong add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "Two things are infinite: the universe and human stupidity; and I'm not sure about the universe." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: Fredstrong add a quote by J.R.R. Tolkien
item.description:
"All that is gold does not glitter, Not all those who wander are lost; The old that is strong does not wither, Deep roots are not reached by the frost.
From the ashes a fire shall be woken, A light from the shadows shall spring; Renewed shall be blade that was broken, The crownless again shall be king." -- J.R.R. Tolkien

item.title: Fredstrong add a quote by Chuck Palahniuk
item.description: "Give me lust, baby. Flash. Give me malice. Flash. Give me detached existentialist ennui. Flash. Give me rampant intellectualism as a coping mechanism. Flash." -- Chuck Palahniuk

item.title: Fredstrong add a quote by Neil Gaiman
item.description: "Fairy tales are more than true: not because they tell us that dragons exist, but because they tell us that dragons can be beaten." -- Neil Gaiman

item.title: Fredstrong add a quote by Christopher Moore
item.description: "It's hard for me, a Jew, to stay in the moment. Without the past, where is the guilt? And without the future, where is the dread? And without guilt and dread, who am I?" -- Christopher Moore

item.title: Fredstrong add a quote by Charles Bukowski
item.description: "according to my figures I've only had 2500 pieces of ass but I've watched 12500 horse races, and if I have any advice to anybody, it's this: take up watercolor painting." -- Charles Bukowski

item.title: Fredstrong add a quote by William Shakespeare
item.description: "The first thing we do, let's kill all the lawyers." -- William Shakespeare

item.title: Fredstrong add a quote by Aleister Crowley
item.description: "One would go mad if one took the Bible seriously; but to take it seriously one must be already mad." -- Aleister Crowley

item.title: Fredstrong add a quote by Nicholas Tharcher
item.description: "The essence of independence has been to think and act according to standards from <i>within</i>, not <i>without</i>: to follow one's own path, not that of the crowd." -- Nicholas Tharcher

item.title: Fredstrong add a quote by Aleister Crowley
item.description: "I slept with faith and found a corpse in my arms on awakening; I drank and danced all night with doubt and found her a virgin in the morning." -- Aleister Crowley

item.title: Fredstrong add a quote by Aleister Crowley
item.description: "The sin which is unpardonable is knowingly and wilfully to reject truth, to fear knowledge lest that knowledge pander not to thy prejudices." -- Aleister Crowley

item.title: Fredstrong add a quote by Aleister Crowley
item.description: "Magick is the science and art of causing change to occur in conformity with will." -- Aleister Crowley

item.title: Fredstrong add a quote by Aleister Crowley
item.description: "For pure will, unassuaged of purpose, delivered from the lust of result, is every way perfect." -- Aleister Crowley

item.title: Fredstrong add a quote by Aleister Crowley
item.description: "The Universe is the Practical Joke of the General at the expense of the Particular, quoth FRATER PERDURABO, and laughed. But those disciples nearest to him wept, seeing the Universal Sorrow. Those next to them laughed, seeing the Universal Joke. Below these certain disciples wept, Then certain laughed. Others next wept. Others next laughed. Next others wept. Next others laughed. Last came those that wept because they could not see the Joke, and those that laughed lest they should be thought not to see the Joke, and thought it safe to act like FRATER PERDURABO. But though FRATER PERDURABO laughed openly, He also at the same time wept secretly; and in Himself He neither laughed nor wept. Nor did He mean what He said." -- Aleister Crowley

item.title: Fredstrong add a quote by Christopher Moore
item.description: "If you think anyone is sane you just don't know enough about them." -- Christopher Moore
